intro: Michelia serrata, commonly known as the serrated michelia, is a flowering plant native to southern China and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows as a small evergreen tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. The bark is smooth and greyish-brown, often exuding a mild fragrance when cut.
